We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD5$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD5$ will be in the hundreds place: 
 $\maroonD{5}$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD7$.  

  So  $\blueD7$ goes in the tens place:  

$\maroonD{5}\blueD7$ $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD9$.  The  $\greenD9$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{5}\blueD7\greenD9$

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{5}\blueD7\greenD9$.
